trans-unit.source: How to resume an app (DirectX and C++)
trans-unit.target: How to resume an app (DirectX and C++)

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to restore important application data when the system resumes your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to restore important application data when the system resumes your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.

trans-unit.source: How to resume an app (DirectX and C++)
trans-unit.target: How to resume an app (DirectX and C++)

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to restore important application data when the system resumes your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to restore important application data when the system resumes your Universal Windows Platform (UWP) DirectX app.

trans-unit.source: Register the resuming event handler
trans-unit.target: Register the resuming event handler

trans-unit.source: Register to handle the [**CoreApplication::Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br205859) event, which indicates that the user switched away from your app and then back to it.
trans-unit.target: Register to handle the [**CoreApplication::Resuming**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br205859) event, which indicates that the user switched away from your app and then back to it.

trans-unit.source: Add this code to your implementation of the [**IFrameworkView::Initialize**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700495) method of your view provider:
trans-unit.target: Add this code to your implementation of the [**IFrameworkView::Initialize**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700495) method of your view provider:

trans-unit.source: Refresh displayed content after suspension
trans-unit.target: Refresh displayed content after suspension

trans-unit.source: When your app handles the Resuming event, it has the opportunity to refresh its displayed content.
trans-unit.target: When your app handles the Resuming event, it has the opportunity to refresh its displayed content.

trans-unit.source: Restore any app you have saved with your handler for [**CoreApplication::Suspending**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br205860), and restart processing.
trans-unit.target: Restore any app you have saved with your handler for [**CoreApplication::Suspending**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br205860), and restart processing.

trans-unit.source: Game devs: if you've suspended your audio engine, now's the time to restart it.
trans-unit.target: Game devs: if you've suspended your audio engine, now's the time to restart it.

trans-unit.source: This callback occurs as an event message processed by the [**CoreDispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211) for the app's [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225).
trans-unit.target: This callback occurs as an event message processed by the [**CoreDispatcher**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208211) for the app's [**CoreWindow**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208225).

trans-unit.source: This callback will not be invoked if you do not call [**CoreDispatcher::ProcessEvents**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208215) from your app's main loop (implemented in the [**IFrameworkView::Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700505) method of your view provider).
trans-unit.target: This callback will not be invoked if you do not call [**CoreDispatcher::ProcessEvents**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br208215) from your app's main loop (implemented in the [**IFrameworkView::Run**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700505) method of your view provider).

trans-unit.source: Remarks
trans-unit.target: Remarks

trans-unit.source: The system suspends your app whenever the user switches to another app or to the desktop.
trans-unit.target: The system suspends your app whenever the user switches to another app or to the desktop.

trans-unit.source: The system resumes your app whenever the user switches back to it.
trans-unit.target: The system resumes your app whenever the user switches back to it.

trans-unit.source: When the system resumes your app, the content of your variables and data structures is the same as it was before the system suspended the app.
trans-unit.target: When the system resumes your app, the content of your variables and data structures is the same as it was before the system suspended the app.

trans-unit.source: The system restores the app exactly where it left off, so that it appears to the user as if it's been running in the background.
trans-unit.target: The system restores the app exactly where it left off, so that it appears to the user as if it's been running in the background.

trans-unit.source: However, the app may have been suspended for a significant amount of time, so it should refresh any displayed content that might have changed while the app was suspended, and restart any rendering or audio processing threads.
trans-unit.target: However, the app may have been suspended for a significant amount of time, so it should refresh any displayed content that might have changed while the app was suspended, and restart any rendering or audio processing threads.

trans-unit.source: If you've saved any game state data during a previous suspend event, restore it now.
trans-unit.target: If you've saved any game state data during a previous suspend event, restore it now.
